subject: RE: [junit] Adding Junit to Eclispe
msgSnippet: Hi, David Sorry I gave the version number for the Eclipse ID for Javascript Developers.  Below are the installation details.  The Eclipse version is 3.6.1:
messageBody:
Hi, David

Sorry I gave the version number for the Eclipse ID for Javascript Developers. Below are the installation details. The Eclipse version is 3.6.1:

Eclipse IDE for Javascript Developers 1.3.1.20100916-1202 epp.package.javascript
Eclipse Platform 3.6.1.M20100909-0800 org.eclipse.platform.ide
Eclipse Platform 3.6.1.r361_v20100909-9gF78GrkFqw7GrsZnvz0JWNTeb6fue6896L org.eclipse.platform.feature.group
Eclipse Help System 1.2.0.v20100427-7e7jEQFEp4jsWcboLU9l93 org.eclipse.help.feature.group
Eclipse RCP 3.6.1.r361_v20100827-9OArFLdFjY-ThSQXmKvKz0_T org.eclipse.rcp.feature.group
Equinox p2 Provisioning 2.0.1.r361_v20100903-897HFZFFZRuSD2LMtVxyz0Vr org.eclipse.equinox.p2.user.ui.feature.group

Thanks, Greg






To: junit@yahoogroups.com
From: david@...
Date: Mon, 14 Feb 2011 11:53:49 -0500
Subject: Re: [junit] Adding Junit to Eclispe






Greg,

Just to be clear, you're hoping to see New > JUnit Test Case on the
right-click list, right?

Are you sure your Eclipse version is 1.3.1.20100916-1201? Eclipse 3
was many years ago. Just a first check. Good luck,

David Saff

On Fri, Feb 11, 2011 at 4:34 PM, Greg Cooper <gregory_cooper@...> wrote:
> Not sure if this is the right forum, but I am trying to get Junit to show in the drop down menu on eclipse. I have right click on the project and clicked on New and was expecting to see Junit as an option here which it wasn't. It also is not showing as an option under the Other selection either. This for:
>
> Eclipse version 1.3.1.20100916-1201
> Junit4.9b2
> Junit4.5
> Junit3.8.2
>
> Any help would be appreciated.
> Thanks, Greg
>
>
>
